(football club)|NEC]] | youthyears4 = 2009–2013 | youthclubs4 = [[Feyenoord]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[Almere City FC|Almere City]] | caps1 = 69 | goals1 = 29 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] | caps2 = 34 | goals2 = 27 | years3 = 2016– | clubs3 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps3 = 28 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] (loan) | caps4 = 16 | goals4 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam1 = Netherlands U15 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalteam2 = Netherlands U16 | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2011 | nationalteam3 = Netherlands U18 | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014 | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national under-20 football team|Netherlands U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 2 | nationalyears5 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam5 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 8 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps6 = 17 | nationalgoals6 = 7 | club-update = 09:19, 17 May 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = 14 November 2017 (UTC) }}
'''Vincent Petrus Anna Sebastiaan Janssen''' (born 15 June 1994) is a Dutch professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for English club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]]. He was awarded the 2016 [[Dutch Footballer of the Year#Dutch Football Talent of the Year .28Young player.29|Johan Cruyff Trophy]], the Dutch "Talent of the Year" award.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Janssen formerly played in [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]] and [[Feyenoord]] youth teams, winning the U19s national title with Feyenoord in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last1=May|first1=Sam|title=The rise of Vincent Janssen: From Almere City to Oranje in 12 months|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/rise-vincent-janssen/|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Football Oranje|date=18 March 2016}}</ref>
After being released by Feyenoord, he joined [[Eerste Divisie]] team [[Almere City FC|Almere City]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Vos|first1=Tim|title=Van Almere naar Wembley: een kleine stap voor Janssen|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-almere-naar-wembley-een-kleine-stap-voor-janssen.htm|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Voetbal International|date=30 March 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref name="skysports">{{cite news|last1=Kabelu|first1=Beya|title=Who is Vincent Janssen? We profile Tottenham's potential new signing|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/10307971/who-is-vincent-janssen-we-profile-tottenhams-potential-new-signing|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Sky Sports|date=9 June 2016}}</ref> He made his debut for Almere on 3 August 2013 in a 3–2 home defeat against [[FC Volendam|Volendam]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Van Almere naar White Hart Lane in veertien maanden |trans-title=From Almere to White Hart Lane in fourteen months|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2117169-van-almere-naar-white-hart-lane-in-veertien-maanden.html|accessdate=13 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=12 July 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref> After netting ten goals in the [[2013–14 Eerste Divisie|2013–14 season]], he reached 19 goals the [[2014–15 Eerste Divisie|following season]].<ref name="espnfc">{{cite news|last1=Yokhin|first1=Michael|title=Alkmaar's Vincent Janssen drawing Ruud van Nistelrooy comparisons|url=http://www.espnfc.com/dutch-eredivisie/11/blog/post/2813252/vincent-janssen-drawing-ruud-van-nistelrooy-comparisons|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=ESPN FC|date=23 February 2016}}</ref> He scored 32 goals in 74 appearances in all competitions for Almere.<ref name="skysports"/>
===AZ=== After two seasons with Almere, Janssen moved to [[Eredivisie]] side [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] in 2015, signing a contract with the club until 2019.<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ legt Coutinho en Janssen vast|trans-title=AZ signs Coutinho and Janssen|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-legt-coutinho-en-janssen-vast~a515e62f/|accessdate=8 June 2016|work=[[Algemeen Dagblad]]|date=27 June 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref> He scored his first official goal for the club against [[İstanbul Başakşehir F.K.|İstanbul Başakşehir]] in a [[UEFA Europa League]] [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round|qualifier]] on 30 July 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ-spits Janssen: "Die keeper moet niet zo wild doen"|trans-title=Az Striker Janssen:"The keeper doesn't have to act so wild"|url=http://www.fcupdate.nl/voetbalnieuws/281116/az-spits-janssen-die-keeper-moet-niet-zo-wild-doen/|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=FCupdate|date=31 July 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Uefa Europa League result AZ Alkmaar vs Istanbul BB|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000656/match=2016806/index.html}}</ref> His first goal in the [[Eredivisie]] was on 4 October 2015, where he scored the first and second goal in a 3–1 home win against [[FC Twente|Twente]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ wacht tegen FC Twente lang op beloning|trans-title=Az has to wait a bit for the reward against FC Twente|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2061233-az-wacht-tegen-fc-twente-lang-op-beloning.html|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=4 October 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=AZ Alkmaar vs FC Twente|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/az-alkmaar-vs-twente/339254}}</ref> After failing to score in his first eight matches for the club, he went on to score 20 league goals in the second half of the season – the first player to achieve this feat in 52 years<ref name="skysports"/> – and became the top scorer of the Eredivisie with a total of 27 goals. This also made him the youngest player to score more than 25 goals in an Eredivisie season since [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] in the [[1994–95 Eredivisie|1994–95 season]].<ref name="ad.nl">[http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1442/AZ/article/detail/4296635/2016/05/08/Vincent-Janssen-topscorer-van-de-Eredivisie.dhtml Vincent Janssen Topscorer van de Eredivisie], Ad.nl</ref><ref name="goal">{{cite web|last1=McVitie|first1=Peter|title=Vincent Janssen – The Eredivisie star who can shine for Tottenham|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/06/10/24473622/vincent-janssen-the-eredivisie-star-who-can-shine-for|website=Goal|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=10 June 2016}}</ref> His first hat-trick for AZ was on 24 January 2016, in a 4–2 home win against former club [[Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Janssen Hat-trick sees AZ Alkmaar stun Feyenoord|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/janssen-hat-trick-sees-az-alkmaar-stun-feyenoord/|website=football-oranje|accessdate=9 July 2016}}</ref> He also scored four goals in a 5–1 home win against [[PEC Zwolle]] on 16 April 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Janssen leidt AZ met vier treffers langs PEC Zwolle |trans-title=Janssen leads AZ with 4 goals along PEC Zwolle|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2099620-janssen-leidt-az-met-vier-treffers-langs-pec-zwolle.html|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=16 April 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref> He was awarded the 2016 [[Dutch Footballer of the Year#Dutch Football Talent of the Year .28Young player.29|Johan Cruyff Trophy]], the Dutch "Talent of the Year" award.<ref name="goal"/><ref name="cruyff award">{{cite web|title=Johan Cruyff Award|url=http://www.cruyff-foundation.org/en/johan-cruyff-award/|website=Cruyff Foundation|accessdate=2 July 2016}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 12 July 2016, Janssen joined [[Premier League]] side [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] for [[Pound sterling|£]]17 million ([[Euro|€]]20 million) on a four-year contract.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/janssen-move-secured-120716/|title=Janssen move secured|date=12 July 2016|work=tottenhamhotspur.com|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2016-07-12/spurs-sign-17m-dutch-striker-janssen/?|title=Spurs sign £17m Dutch striker Janssen|date=12 July 2016|work=itv.com|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref> Manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]] had seen Janssen during a [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] friendly with the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]], saying Janssen "ticked all the boxes we needed". With his signing, he became the most expensive player sold by AZ Alkmaar in their football history.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kilpatrick|first1=Dan|title=Tottenham Hotspur sign Netherlands international striker Vincent Janssen|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2911444/tottenham-sign-netherlands-international-striker-vincent-janssen|accessdate=12 July 2016|work=ESPNFC|date=12 July 2016}}</ref>
Janssen played in [[2016–17 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|three friendlies]] for Tottenham before the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]], providing a goal and an assist in the final game against [[Inter Milan]]. Janssen made his Premier League debut on 13 August, coming on as a substitute for [[Eric Dier]] against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. He made his first start the next week at home to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], playing at forward the full 90 minutes. Following an ankle injury to star [[Harry Kane]] on 18 September, Janssen was thrust into a larger role for the club, with Pochettino stating "this is a big opportunity for him to show what he can do".<ref name="espnfc2">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/tottenham-hotspur/story/2955008/tottenhams-mauricio-pochettino-time-for-vincent-janssen-to-step-up |title=Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino: Time for Vincent Janssen to step up |work=ESPN FC |first=Dan |last=Kilpatrick |date=20 September 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 21 September 2016, converting a penalty in a 5–0 victory in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] against [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Allnutt|first1=Tom|title=Tottenham news: Vincent Janssen keen to impress for Spurs in absence of injured Harry Kane|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-news-vincent-janssen-keen-to-impress-for-spurs-in-absence-of-injured-harry-kane-a7323001.html|accessdate=23 September 2016|work=The Independent|date=22 September 2016}}</ref> His first Premier League goal, another penalty, was on 29 October in a 1–1 draw with [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-oranje.com/janssen-ends-wait-first-premier-league-goal/ |title=Janssen ends wait for first Premier League goal |work=football-oranje.com|accessdate=30 October 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal from open play for Tottenham on 12 March 2017, scoring the fifth goal in a 6–0 FA Cup Quarter Final win over [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/match/report/spurs-v-millwall-match-report-120317/|title=Spurs 6-0 Millwall - match in focus 12 March 2017 - News - tottenhamhotspur.com|website=www.tottenhamhotspur.com|language=en|access-date=13 March 2017}}</ref> On 4 September 2017, it was confirmed that Janssen had been omitted from Spurs' Champions League squad for the 2017–18 campaign.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-champions-league-squad-list-erik-lamela-vincent-janssen-left-out-a7928951.html|title=Erik Lamela and Vincent Janssen left out of Tottenham's Champions League squad with only 21 players named |work=The Independent|accessdate=4 September 2017}}</ref>
On 8 September 2017, Janssen joined [[Süper Lig]] club [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] for the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Vincent Janssen joins Fenerbahce from Tottenham on season's loan|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/08/fenerbahce-vincent-janssen-tottenham-loan|publisher=The Guardian|date=8 September 2017 |accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on his debut in Turkey in a 4–1 win over [[Alanyaspor]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2017/09/18/spurs-flop-vincent-janssen-showing-newcastle-united-what-they-co/ |title=Spurs flop Vincent Janssen showing Newcastle United what they could have had |first=Danny |last=Owen |work=HITC |date=18 September 2017}}</ref> and a second in the Istanbul derby against [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] that resulted in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/vincent-janssen-says-he-has-found-salvation-at-fenerbahce-after-leaving-tottenham-a3642411.html |title=Vincent Janssen says he has found 'salvation' at Fenerbahce after leaving Tottenham |first=James |last= Benge |work= Evening Standard |date=25 September 2017 }}</ref> However, he was injured against [[Bursaspor]] in early December, and was out of action for a few months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportwitness.co.uk/tottenham-worry-injury-causing-increasing-concern-surgery-risky-reports-germany/ |title=Tottenham worry as injury causing increasing concern, surgery risky, reports to Germany|date= 26 January 2018 |work=Sport Witness }}</ref>
In summer 2018 Janssen returned to Tottenham but at the beginning of the 2018–19 season he was not issued a number.<ref name="201819skysports">{{cite web |title=Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen undergoes minor foot surgery |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/11478440/tottenham-striker-vincent-janssen-undergoes-minor-foot-surgery |website=Sky Sports |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=21 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/teams/first-team/players/ |title=First Team |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Football Club |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref> Spurs reported on their website that Janssen had surgery for a foot injury and would be in recovery with the club's medical staff.<ref name="201819skysports"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/2018/august/janssen-injury-update/ |title=Janssen injury update |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Football Club |date=21 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Janssen received his first call up to the senior [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands team]] in March 2016 for friendlies against [[France national football team|France]] and [[England national football team|England]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Arjen Robben pulls out of Holland squad to face France and England with a thigh injury|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3497216/Arjen-Robben-pulls-Holland-squad-face-France-England-thigh-injury.html|accessdate=18 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=17 March 2016}}</ref> In his first international start, a 1–2 win against England on 29 March 2016, he scored his first senior international goal and provided his first assist on the other.<ref>{{cite news|title=England suffer double Dutch blow after Jamie Vardy strike thrills Wembley|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/pa/article-3514689/England-suffer-double-Dutch-blow-Jamie-Vardy-strike-thrills-Wembley.html|accessdate=30 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=30 March 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[File:Vincent_Janssen_Penalty_(25866552990).jpg|thumb|300px|Vincent Janssen lining up to take a penalty against England in March 2016.]]
A two-footed player,<ref name="goal"/><ref name="fourfourtwo">{{cite web|last1=Ramesh|first1=Priya|title=All about Vincent Janssen: The Eredivisie top scorer wooing Wenger and Arsenal|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/vincent-janssen-dutchman-wooing-arsenal-liverpool-and-manchester|website=FourFourTwo|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=10 May 2016}}</ref> Janssen is credited with good finishing, movement and pace.<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/><ref name="outside">{{cite web|last1=Lynch|first1=Alex|title=Scout Report: Vincent Janssen|url=http://outsideoftheboot.com/2016/04/19/36320/|website=Outside of the boot|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=19 April 2016}}</ref> Due to his strength,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="goal"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/> he is an "exceptional" hold-up man<ref name="skysports"/> who can bring teammates into play,<ref name="goal"/> and as a good passer of the ball,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/><ref name="outside"/> he can set up goal-scoring opportunities for teammates.<ref name="bleacher">{{cite web|last1=McNicholas|first1=James|title=Who Is Vincent Janssen and What Would He Bring to Arsenal?|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2638363-who-is-vincent-janssen-and-what-would-he-bring-to-arsenal|website=Bleacher Report|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=6 May 2016}}</ref> He is also praised for his work ethic,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/> as well as his competitive mentality.<ref name="espnfc2"/> Janssen's style of play has invited comparisons with [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]].<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="espnfc"/>
His weaknesses are shots from outside the penalty box, the timing of his movement and ball control.<ref name="fourfourtwo"/>
==Personal life== Janssen is the son of [[Annemarie Verstappen]], a former world champion swimmer and [[Dutch Sportswoman of the year]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Jeremy|title=Arsenal transfer news: Holland striker Vincent Janssen a summer target|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/05/arsenal-transfer-news-holland-striker-vincent-janssen-a-summer-t/|accessdate=8 June 2016|work=The Telegraph|date=5 May 2016}}</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 8 January 2019}}<ref name=SW>{{Soccerway|vincent-janssen/303286}}</ref>

(football)|Fenerbahçe]] |[[2017–18 Süper Lig|2017–18]] |[[Süper Lig]] |16||4||2||1||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||18||5 |- !colspan=3|Career totals !147!!62!!11!!6!!2!!2!!16!!3!!2!!1!!180!!74 |} <references group="nb" />
